comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Now here's an interesting comparison shot by Charles Bayliss circa 1888 "WATERFALLS MOSSMANS BAY" nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn3297333 Bayliss' photograph is undoubtedly of the same falls, and Bayliss has stood a bit closer than Henry King. Bayliss has taken his shot through the "V" formed by the trees. A "V" which has been formed by the removal of the tree trunk in the middle of the "V". I wonder who cut the tree trunk? Bayliss or King?
